intro: Oyedaea steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's oyedaea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
